channel.title: 纽约时报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Harvard will not require SAT or ACT scores for admission through the next four years, extending a policy adopted during the coronavirus pandemic and adding fuel to the movement to permanently eliminate standardized test scores for admission. https://t.co/mdKaveBpNs
Super Typhoon Rai brought heavy rain and flooding to the southeastern part of the Philippines on Thursday, displacing thousands over a large area. https://t.co/HQErmPRTtJ https://t.co/NTxyOPl6NI

Harvard will not require SAT or ACT scores for admission through the next four years, extending a policy adopted during the coronavirus pandemic and adding fuel to the movement to permanently eliminate standardized test scores for admission. https://t.co/5r5IC1IpuI
Breaking News: A CDC panel recommended other Covid vaccines over Johnson & Johnson’s, citing the link to a rare but potentially fatal blood clotting disorder. https://t.co/nOXnjjEMnT
Breaking News: A federal judge overturned Purdue Pharma’s opioid settlement, ruling that the Sackler family could not receive protection from civil lawsuits. https://t.co/fAQnifIw69

Nearly all active-duty members of the Army and Navy — 98% — are vaccinated against Covid-19. The service members who still refuse shots will be dismissed, the military said. Thousands of troops requested religious exemptions, but none have been granted. https://t.co/icQ2yqcmLO

Breaking News: Women can get abortion pills by mail for pregnancies up to 10 weeks without seeing a doctor in person, the FDA ruled. The decision comes as the Supreme Court considers whether to roll back abortion rights or even overturn Roe v. Wade. https://t.co/Oc8jDUpHJl https://t.co/4ZY84CtzAH

Breaking News: Women can get abortion pills by mail for pregnancies up to 10 weeks without seeing a doctor in person, the FDA ruled. The decision comes as the Supreme Court considers whether to roll back abortion rights or even overturn Roe v. Wade. https://t.co/hutMjelRXU

Turkey's bakers say they can't afford to keep making bread because of price controls and rising inflation. And their customers can't afford to buy it anyway. https://t.co/Kw9IFREzPc https://t.co/23xF9ZyKpi

bell hooks, whose incisive, wide-ranging writing on gender and race helped push feminism beyond its white, middle-class worldview to include the voices of Black and working-class women, died on Wednesday. She was 69. https://t.co/9JNRSGKsoj https://t.co/nmjhFMJ1LP

While visiting Kentucky, President Biden praised the communities affected by the deadly tornadoes last weekend for how they’ve come together to handle the severe devastation. https://t.co/yu9heYfOwL https://t.co/SiNaDr50TL
Breaking News: Bruce Springsteen sold his music rights to Sony in a deal that may exceed $500 million in value, people briefed on the matter said. https://t.co/93GV2zDeO0
Keechant Sewell, the Nassau County chief of detectives, will become New York City’s first female police commissioner. https://t.co/mMCrZVJYEw

A group of people handcuffed a principal in northern Greece and took him to the police, suggesting that officers arrest him for enforcing Covid measures at a school.
Instead, the group was detained and now faces abduction charges. https://t.co/ys0eE5LWOv

Kroger, the U.S. supermarket operator, has eliminated paid Covid-19 leave for unvaccinated employees and will charge salaried employees who are enrolled in a company health care plan $50 a month if they remain unvaccinated, a spokeswoman said. https://t.co/7P6htEoEiY

Jordan Baize saw that the roof of his house in Kentucky had blown away during a tornado. But his Yamaha piano was still intact.
Under an overcast sky, Baize sat alone in his living room and started to play a song that had been stuck in his head for days. https://t.co/s7HZIl751f https://t.co/MR2q5FfhAF

Chicago's City Council approved a $2.9 million settlement on Wednesday for Anjanette Young, a medical social worker who was forced to stand naked in front of a dozen police officers who burst into her home to execute a search warrant in 2019. https://t.co/lGvOxtTSvs

Turkey's bakers say they can't afford to keep making bread because of price controls and rising inflation. And their customers can't afford to buy it anyway. https://t.co/eAkJChhEPf https://t.co/0lUzziU4Hj

bell hooks, whose incisive, wide-ranging writing on gender and race helped push feminism beyond its white, middle-class worldview to include the voices of Black and working-class women, died on Wednesday. She was 69. https://t.co/TUrsklsxAe https://t.co/Rhylcf0nwQ
Breaking News: Covid deaths in the U.S. surpassed 800,000, the highest known number of any country in the world. https://t.co/NZjAnVZSyo https://t.co/KBieNaUAwK

bell hooks, whose incisive, wide-ranging writing on gender and race helped push feminism beyond its white, middle-class worldview to include the voices of Black and working-class women, died on Wednesday. She was 69. https://t.co/uT7qoRZbV7 https://t.co/hW0CeOyfZ2

Steph Curry on Tuesday set a new NBA career record for 3-pointers, surpassing Ray Allen, who finished his career with 2,973 made 3-pointers and held the record for 10 years. https://t.co/YzNpTmqJrc https://t.co/PzDr2nEjt2

Malta became the first country in the E.U. to agree to legalize marijuana for recreational purposes, allowing people to carry up to seven grams of marijuana, grow up to four plants in their apartments and keep up to 50 grams of dried cannabis at home. https://t.co/JmncYxjsbp https://t.co/6DE8F1lpAn

A man returned to his Kentucky home to find that it had been largely demolished by a tornado, but that his piano was still intact. Listen as he plays the Christian worship song "There’s Something About That Name." https://t.co/qZrWIyetOY https://t.co/TTjQAP1EUJ

Breaking News: Booster doses of the Moderna and Pfizer Covid vaccines are likely to offer a substantial increase in protection against the Omicron variant, Dr. Anthony Fauci said. https://t.co/HxbFldlSNg
Breaking News: The House recommended criminal contempt charges for Mark Meadows, Donald Trump’s ex-chief of staff, for stonewalling the Jan. 6 inquiry. https://t.co/kLc9vF8XeV

First breakups. Final goodbyes. For generations, Vicente Fernández, the Mexican ranchera superstar who died on Sunday at 81, sung often sorrowful songs that have served as a balm for the heartbroken. https://t.co/sq7BZwjIgK

Kroger, the U.S. supermarket operator, has eliminated paid Covid-19 leave for unvaccinated employees and will charge salaried employees who are enrolled in a company health care plan $50 a month if they remain unvaccinated, a spokeswoman said. https://t.co/UCtSB9Pmsr

North Korea has publicly executed at least seven people in the past decade for watching or distributing K-pop videos, as it cracks down on what its leader, Kim Jong-un, calls a “vicious cancer,” according to a human rights report. https://t.co/oYKz2y9QUr

Breaking News: Derek Chauvin pleaded guilty to using his position as a police officer to violate George Floyd’s constitutional rights. The move will likely lengthen Chauvin’s time in prison for murdering Floyd. https://t.co/WxYjv9mWKD
A new eye drop could make misplaced reading glasses less of an inconvenience for many of the 128 million Americans who suffer from age-related deficits in near vision. https://t.co/MUyPHH1SkZ

Meet China’s newest propaganda tool: Foreign YouTubers who speak up for Beijing and reap rewards in money or clicks.
Their videos might look casual, but they are part of the Communist Party's efforts to shape the global conversation about China. https://t.co/mgzvc6JhDm
Breaking News: A federal judge dismissed a lawsuit by Donald Trump that sought to block Congress from obtaining his tax returns. https://t.co/KbfddXUeRk

Around Antarctica, a vast current acts as the world's climate engine. New science is revealing the power it holds over the future, and researchers are alarmed at what they’re learning as ice shelves retreat. https://t.co/SVAM19gX6d https://t.co/xytcRDgvbf

Stephen Curry on Tuesday set a new NBA career record for 3-pointers, surpassing Ray Allen, who finished his career with 2,973 made 3-pointers and held the record for 10 years. https://t.co/E2vT3bRdBe https://t.co/TgbI3NG2qr

At least two drugmakers want to ask the FDA to switch their birth-control pills from prescription to over-the-counter, but after more than five years of prolonged trial processes and dialogue, they still haven't yet been able to apply. https://t.co/Oka9i2S3TR https://t.co/nBAWiWjjRU

Pfizer announced that its Covid pill helped stave off severe disease in lab studies against the Omicron variant, which is surging in South Africa and Europe and is expected to dominate U.S. cases in the weeks ahead. https://t.co/7cVhOd6Ueq https://t.co/8DWqXeyhmf
Breaking News: Stephen Curry made his 2,974th 3-pointer, breaking the NBA career record held by Ray Allen. https://t.co/g4nH81bql7

Cornell University moved finals exams to an online format, closed libraries and gyms, barred visitors from campus and took other restrictive measures after the school’s Covid testing lab found evidence of the Omicron variant in a number of students’ tests. https://t.co/sgKmhbwULN

Keechant Sewell, the Nassau County chief of detectives, will become New York City's first female police commissioner. Her appointment was seen as one of the most important decisions for Eric Adams, the incoming mayor, as he fills out his administration. https://t.co/geRlhpYUlN https://t.co/zUZuI4wZti

The HPV vaccine, which only works when administered before people become infected by the virus, can prevent as many as 90% of six potentially lethal cancers. Yet, it's being met with rising resistance from parents. https://t.co/C3QHMOwqhz
Breaking News: Keechant Sewell will be the first woman to lead the New York Police Department, taking over the largest police force in the U.S. at a key moment. https://t.co/bB4SQbWY8r

The posthumous brain examination of Phillip Adams, a retired NFL player who shot and killed six people in April before fatally shooting himself, revealed that he had an "unusually severe" form of CTE, a brain disease linked with repeated hits to the head. https://t.co/S2zJpLejcG

The Jan. 6 panel recommended on Monday that Mark Meadows, the last White House chief of staff for Donald Trump, be charged with criminal contempt of Congress for defying its subpoena. The House was poised to do the same on Tuesday. https://t.co/EKglg5Ri9A https://t.co/qQbn3XY9t2

Joshua Bellamy, a former New York Jets player who fraudulently obtained more than $1.2 million in Covid relief money and spent tens of thousands of dollars of it on luxury items, has been sentenced to about three years in prison. https://t.co/hcfaMvme3s
New prescription eye drops can help users see up close without affecting their long-range vision — and may mean they can ditch their reading glasses for a few hours. https://t.co/w5B2HkjOe7

With the future of Roe v. Wade in the hands of the Supreme Court, we took a look at the current state of abortion in America. The abortion rate has fallen in recent decades, but the procedure is still common. Here’s what the typical patient looks like. https://t.co/KsFbQpJFoY https://t.co/VOVMm5rNtk

Breaking News: Former Gov. Andrew Cuomo was ordered to turn over about $5.1 million in proceeds from his 2020 pandemic memoir to the state attorney general by a New York ethics board. https://t.co/9AuW3jf3oI

"It just seems insulting and absurd to have teachers doing an event like this to raise a few hundred dollars for their classrooms," a South Dakota state senator said. "What other profession would be asked to fund-raise this way?" https://t.co/cq3BFlvxGl
Philadelphia will require proof of vaccination to eat or drink indoors starting Jan. 3, city officials announced on Monday. Covid cases have been rising rapidly in the city. https://t.co/Io8mCxSNoJ
